content.main_concept: Most neuroendocrine disorders require lifetime treatment with medications
content.key_points:
**Conditions requiring lifetime medications**

| Condition | Medication |
|-----------|------------|
| Myasthenia Gravis | Anticholinesterase (MESTINON) |
| Hyperthyroidism | Antithyroid drugs (PTU) |
| AIDS | ART (Tenofovir and Emtricitabine) |
| Parkinson's Disease | Dopaminergic agents (L-DOPA) |
| Addison's Disease | Glucocorticoids (DELTASONE) |
| Cushing's disease | Glucocorticoid synthesis inhibitors (Mitotane) |
| Diabetes Mellitus | Insulin (NPH, REGULAR) |
| Glaucoma | Miotics (PILOCARPINE) |
| Hypothyroidism | Thyroid Supplement (SYNTHROID) |
| Pernicious Anemia | Vitamin B12 |
| Schizophrenia | Antipsychotics (Risperidone, Olanzapine) |

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements, if made by a client with diabetes mellitus, reflects a need for further instructions?
options: 1. "I will need some orange juice when I experience cold clammy skin."
2. "I will need to take my medication on time."
3. "I will need to take my medication for the rest of my life."
4. "I'm glad I will only take my medications until I reach 20."
questions.rationale: **RATIONALE**\n\nThe client's statement "I'm glad I will only take my medication until I reach 20" indicates a need for further instructions because neuro endocrine disorders like diabetes mellitus require lifetime intake of medication.

extraction_metadata.notes: Right page concept from PDF page 47. Key points formatted as markdown table per user specification. No medical images per user specification.
extraction_metadata.reference: Karch, Amy, Lippincott's Nursing Drug Guide Philadelphia, Lippincott Williams and Wilkins
